intro: Cyclocodon lancifolius subsp. celebicus, commonly known as the Celebes cyclocodon, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
